column4: ok, reinstalled compiz and a bunch of other compiz related stuff and still getting the same errors. :-(
What video card?
Someone will know... but you may end up leaving effects off
What all did you install or try , and what were you trying to fix or do in the beginning

In answer to your question: ok, well I installed gutsy from the alternate install CD (I just like that better, the install seems to run faster) ... and then I ran the updates and then I removed evolution and installed thunderbird and ubuntu restricted extra from synaptic in one shot and decided at that point I'd best reboot and see how it was going and the problem started occuring when it came back up then.
No reason at all for that system to be acting up at that point
Sorry but did you make any changes to the repos before you updated.
yeah, but it is, heh ... Next on my list was going to be installing flash (from the tarball since the synaptic installer doesn't work right now), and a few other bits.
only to uncheck the CD so it would go to the net for everything.
I would not continue..  I would reinstall the live cd
just those two things didnt cause that problem
Morning,  which one
Glad you got it narrowed down.  I suggest a backup at this point.. one command in a cli will do it..
tar cvpzf backupdell.tgz --exclude=/backupdell.tgz --exclude=/proc --exclude=/lost+found  --exclude=/mnt --exclude=/sys --exclude=/media --exclude=/root/.Trash -- /
Always remember to exclude the backup from the backup to avoid endless loop situation
yep, thx
do you know how to tell apt to ignore a particular package or packages for upgrading?  I think it may have to do with pinning the particular version of a package?
YEs, that is it, but no I dont know how as I have never done it
ok, I'll just look it up, then, probably tomorrow as it's 2am here.
That seldom works right
bot is in for an oil change
